definition: to save/to economize/to do without/to omit/to leave out/province/(archaic) central government department
to inspect/to examine/to be aware/to pay a visit (to one's parents or elders)
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: The ellipsis is the punctuation mark (…) that indicates an intentional omission.
sentences.chinese: 省略号表示的是作者蓄意的省略。

sentences.english: Here I need to put a long series of ellipsis so I account for no details.
sentences.chinese: 后来就是一长串的省略号，就不细说了。

sentences.english: Avoid lazy text-inspired speak, with overuse of dot-dot-dot’s and consecutive commas.
sentences.chinese: 过多使用省略号和连续逗号。

sentences.english: They pull on the river left a string of footprints, it was wayfarers ellipsis of life.
sentences.chinese: 纤夫在河边留下一串脚印，那是跋涉者生活的省略号。

sentences.english: You no doubt noticed the ellipsis in the code above.
sentences.chinese: 您一定注意到上述代码中的省略号。

sentences.english: The elipses in the middle represent a bunch more matches.
sentences.chinese: 中间的省略号表示了一批更多的匹配。

sentences.english: Truncates text that does not fit in the rectangle and adds ellipsis.
sentences.chinese: 截断无法放入矩形框的文本并添加省略号。

definition: Chinese back-sloping comma 、 (punct. used to separate items in a list)
dash/Chinese dash ── (punct., double the length of the western dash)
blank/blank space on a form/space/囗 (indicating missing or illegible character)
Chinese underdot (punct. used for emphasis, sim. to Western italics)
